verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. A Psalm, a Song. God<WH430> be merciful<WH2603> unto us<WH1288>, and bless us<WH6440>, And cause his face to shine<WH215> upon us<WH5542>; [[Selah
That thy way<WH1870> may be known<WH3045> upon earth<WH776>, Thy salvation<WH3444> among all nations<WH1471>.
Let the peoples<WH5971> praise<WH3034> thee<WH430>, O God; Let all the peoples<WH5971> praise thee<WH3034>.

Oh let the nations<WH3816> be glad<WH8055> and sing for joy<WH7442>; For thou wilt judge<WH8199> the peoples<WH5971> with equity<WH4334>, And govern<WH5148> the nations<WH5971> upon earth<WH776>. <WH5542>[[Selah
Let the peoples<WH5971> praise<WH3034> thee<WH430>, O God; Let all the peoples<WH5971> praise thee<WH3034>.
The earth<WH776> hath yielded<WH5414> its increase<WH2981>: God<WH430>, even our own God<WH430>, will bless us<WH1288>.
God <WH430> will bless<WH1288> us<WH657>; And all the ends of the earth<WH776> shall fear him<WH3372>.
